etymologies: late 19th century. From pteraspid-, taken as stem of scientific Latin Pteraspis Pteraspis: see -id. Compare scientific Latin Pteraspidae, former family name

definitions: An armoured, jawless fossil fish (ostracoderm) of the family Pteraspididae (formerly Pteraspidae), found in rocks of the Silurian and Devonian periods.
Of, relating to, or characteristic of the family Pteraspididae.
